title: Oil Tops $110, Stock Futures Edge Up Ahead of Powell, OPEC
sub_head: Crude prices surge above $110 a barrel for first time since 2014 as Russia struggles to maintain energy sales
body:
U.S. stocks futures wavered, while oil prices jumped, as Russia pounded Ukrainian cities and investors awaited testimony from Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell and a meeting of the Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries and its allies.
Futures for the S&P 500 crept up 0.1% Wednesday, a day after the benchmark index fell 1.6%. Contracts for the Dow Jones Industrial Average rose 0.2% and those for the technology-focused Nasdaq-100 ticked up 0.1%.
